Class TransitDb

A transit db contains all connections, trips and stops.

TransitDb(Action<TransitDb.TransitDbWriter, DateTime, DateTime>)

Construct a TransitDb, optionally with a callback to load something in the database

Declaration
public TransitDb(Action<TransitDb.TransitDbWriter, DateTime, DateTime> updateTimeFrame = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Action<TransitDb.TransitDbWriter, System.DateTime, System.DateTime> updateTimeFrame

This function should add data via the writer. The writer will be closed when the callback finishes

| Improve this Doc View Source

GetWriter()

Gets a writer. A writer can add or update entries in the database. Once all updates are done, the writer should be closed to apply the changes.

Declaration
public TransitDb.TransitDbWriter GetWriter()
Returns
Type Description
TransitDb.TransitDbWriter

A writer.
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.InvalidOperationException

Throws if there is already a writer active.

UpdateTimeFrame(DateTime, DateTime, Boolean)

Loads more data into the transitDB, as specified by the callbackfunction.

Declaration
public void UpdateTimeFrame(DateTime start, DateTime end, bool refresh = false)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.DateTime start
System.DateTime end
System.Boolean refresh

If true, overwrites. If false, only the gaps will be filled
